DOC.brief_summary: hysterosalpingography is a diagnosis procedure in the evaluation of infertile women and considered to be the traditional and the gold standard in the assessment of the patency of the fallopian tubes. The major disadvantage of hysterosalpingography is pain. In a study reported the patients complained of moderate to severe pain during the procedure. It is reported that some patients undergoing hysterosalpingography was more stressful and anxiety and effect on pain scores.
DOC.brief_title: Oral Hyoscine Butyl Bromide With Cervical Lidocaine Cream in Reducing Pain During Hysterosalpingography
